introduction: The Foundations in Semiconductor Physics Lab II offers an interactive platform to explore advanced concepts in semiconductor devices. It uses the concepts discussed in 'The Foundations in Semiconductor Physics Lab 1' and explores opto-electronics & high speed devices.

experiments.name: Optoelectronics: Photodiodes, LEDs, and Solar Cells
High-Speed Carrier Transport and Tunneling Devices

objective:
Key Learning Outcomes
Understanding Quantum Mechanics: Visualize Schrodinger’s Wave Equation, Fermi Level, Density of States, and Carrier Transport through interactive simulations.
Linking Theory to Application:Explore how changes in material properties, temperature, doping, external potential influence semiconductor behavior.
Strengthening Practical Skills:Gain hands-on experience in analyzing semiconductor devices, enhancing problem-solving and critical thinking.

universities: Electronic Devices is a professional core course in Electronics and Communication Engineering (PCC-EC01) recommended in the AICTE model curriculum.
